00026 -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00027 PCZone.h  -  Portal Connected Zone (PCZone) header file.
00028 -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00029 Portal Connected Zones are spatial constructs for partitioning space into cross
00030 connected zones.  Each zone is connected to other zones using Portal nodes.
00031 
00032 Zones contain references to nodes which touch them.  However, zones do not
00033 care how nodes are arranged hierarchically.  Whether or not a node is 
00034 referenced as being part of a zone is entirely determined by the user or
00035 by the node crossing a portal into or out-of the zone.
00036 
00037 Nodes can be referenced by several zones at once, but only one zone is
00038 considered the "home" zone of the node.  Home zone is determined by location
00039 of the centerpoint of the node.  Nodes can "touch" other zones if the node 
00040 BV intersects a portal (this is also called "visiting" a zone).  Nodes keep
00041 a pointer to their home zone and a list of references to zones they are 
00042 "visiting".
00043 -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00044 begin                : Tue Feb 20 2007
00045 author               : Eric Cha
00046 email                : ericc@xenopi.com
00047 Code Style Update    :
00048 -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00049 */
00050

00108

00110         */

00243         virtual void getAABB(AxisAlignedBox &);
00244         void setPortalsUpdated(bool updated)   { mPortalsUpdated = updated;    }
00245         bool getPortalsUpdated(void)      { return mPortalsUpdated;   }
00246         /* get & set the user data */
00247         void * getUserData(void) {return mUserData;}
00248         void setUserData(void * userData) {mUserData = userData;}
00251         PortalList mPortals;
00252         AntiPortalList mAntiPortals;
00253         // pointer to the pcz scene manager that created this zone
00254         PCZSceneManager * mPCZSM;
00255 
00256     protected:
00258         struct PortalSortDistance
00259         {
00260             const Vector3& cameraPosition;
00261             PortalSortDistance(const Vector3& inCameraPosition) : cameraPosition(inCameraPosition)
00262             { }
00263 
00264             bool _OgrePCZPluginExport operator()(const PortalBase* p1, const PortalBase* p2) const
00265             {
00266                 Real depth1 = p1->getDerivedCP().squaredDistance(cameraPosition);
00267                 Real depth2 = p2->getDerivedCP().squaredDistance(cameraPosition);
00268                 return (depth1 < depth2);
00269             }
00270         };
00271 
00272         // name of the zone (must be unique)
00273         String mName;
00275         String mZoneTypeName;
00276         // frame counter for visibility
00277         unsigned long mLastVisibleFrame;
00278         // last camera which this zone was visible to
00279         PCZCamera * mLastVisibleFromCamera;
00280         // flag determining whether or not this zone has sky in it.
00281         bool mHasSky;
00282         //SceneNode which corresponds to the enclosure for this zone
00283         SceneNode * mEnclosureNode;
00284         // list of SceneNodes contained in this particular PCZone
00285         PCZSceneNodeList mHomeNodeList;
00286         // list of SceneNodes visiting this particular PCZone
00287         PCZSceneNodeList mVisitorNodeList;
00288         // flag recording whether any portals in this zone have moved 
00289         bool mPortalsUpdated;   
00290         // user defined data pointer - NOT allocated or deallocated by the zone!  
00291         // you must clean it up yourself!
00292         void * mUserData;
00293 
00294     };
